Keratinization and Intercellular Bridges: Squamous differentiation; keratin production; keratin pearls; intercellular bridges
Intraepithelial Tumor Growth: Intraepithelial growth; tumor spread within epithelial structures
Cell Morphology: Polygonal tumor cells; abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm; high keratin content
Nuclear Characteristics: Hyperchromatic nuclei; prominent nucleoli; variable pleomorphism
Desmoplastic Stroma: Reactive stromal response; dense fibrous stroma surrounding tumor cells
Cavitation: Cavitation; central necrosis; more common in squamous cell carcinoma; visible on imaging
Endobronchial Growth: Endobronchial growth; visible during bronchoscopy; growth within bronchial lumen
Density of Inflammatory Cells: High density of inflammatory cells; lymphocytes; macrophages; dendritic cells; neutrophils; within tumor microenvironment (TME)
Tumor-Associated Lymphocytes: Tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes (TILs); indicative of immune infiltration; predominantly T cells; CD8+ cytotoxic T cells; CD4+ helper T cells; favorable prognosis
Immune Cell Clusters: Immune cell clusters; invasive margin; active immune surveillance; B cells; tertiary lymphoid structures; lymph node-like organization
Expression of Immune Checkpoint Proteins: Immune checkpoint proteins overexpression; PD-L1; altered immune pathways; immune evasion; detectable by IHC
Distribution Pattern: Immune cell distribution; diffuse infiltration favorable; marginal/patchy less favorable
Immune Cell Morphology: Activated immune cell morphology; larger nuclei; visible nucleoli; abundant cytoplasm
Granzyme B and Perforin Expression: Cytotoxic protein expression; granzyme B; perforin; active cytotoxic T cells; IHC visualization
FOXP3+ Regulatory T Cells: FOXP3+ regulatory T cells; immune response indicator; potential suppression of anti-tumor response; CD8+ to FOXP3+ Tregs ratio prognostic
Immune Cell Polarization: Macrophage polarization markers; M1 pro-inflammatory; M2 anti-inflammatory/tissue repair; iNOS (M1); CD163 (M2)
Tumor-Associated Macrophage Phenotypes: M2 macrophage prevalence; immunosuppressive environment indication
Cytokine and Chemokine Levels: Cytokines and chemokines detection; IHC; IL-6; TGF-beta; pro-tumorigenic environment
T-Cell Exhaustion Markers: T-cell exhaustion markers; PD-1; CTLA-4; LAG-3; TIM-3; CD8+ T cells; impaired functionality
Regulatory T Cells (Tregs): Regulatory T cells presence; FOXP3 staining; immunosuppressive environment; tumor growth promotion
Granzyme B and Perforin: Granzyme B and perforin in CD8+ T cells; active immune response; absence indicates ineffective response
Tertiary Lymphoid Structures: Tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) presence; immune response indicator; B and T cells; lymph node-like; detectable by IHC
Necrosis and Apoptosis: Necrosis and apoptosis surrounded by immune cells; potential anti-tumor response
Stromal Changes: Tumor stroma changes; fibrosis; immune cell presence; indicative of altered immune pathways; IHC evaluation
High Number Leukocytes and Platelets: High leukocyte density; tumor parenchyma and stroma; small round cells; high nucleus-to-cytoplasm ratio; diffuse infiltration or clusters
High Ki-67 Index: Ki-67 high labeling index; cellular proliferation marker; correlated with high-grade tumors; poor prognosis
p53 Overexpression: TP53 mutation; p53 protein overexpression; higher grade tumor indication; IHC detection
Increased Cellular and Nuclear Pleomorph: Cellular and nuclear pleomorphism; increased variability; indicative of higher malignancy; IHC highlighted
High Mitotic Rate: High mitotic figure count; rapid cell proliferation; visualized by mitotic markers
Loss of Differentiation Markers: Differentiation marker loss; less differentiated tumor; more aggressive; IHC assessment
Vascular and Lymphatic Invasion: Tumor cells in blood vessels or lymphatics; potential for metastasis; CD31 and podoplanin (D2-40) markers
Overexpression of Growth Factor Receptor: Growth factor receptors high levels; EGFR; VEGFR; aggressive cancer behavior; IHC detection
Invasion Depth: Deeper tissue invasion; higher grade tumor; IHC staining of tumor-stromal boundaries
Tumor Budding: Tumor budding presence; aggressive behavior indicator; cytokeratin stains highlight
Reduced Expression of Cell Adhesion Mole: E-cadherin reduced expression; epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT); increased invasiveness and metastasis; IHC detection
Expression of Metastasis-Related Protein: N-cadherin and vimentin upregulation; EMT involvement; cell migration; malignant phenotype; IHC detection
CDKN1A Protein Overexpression: CDKN1A (p21) nuclear staining increase; nuclear protein; p21-specific antibody usage
SOX2 Protein Overexpression: SOX2 intense nuclear staining; transcription factor; localized in nucleus; notable at invasive tumor edges
